name: Quick Whole Wheat Chapati
author: desertdweller
summary: Chapati is an unleavened whole wheat bread that is eaten in India. We love to use it as a wrap.
directions: Mix flour and salt together in a bowl
Stir in water to form a soft dough
Turn dough out onto a lightly floured work surface and knead several times
Divide into 8 pieces and roll each into a ball
Roll each ball into a very thin round using a rolling pin
Heat a griddle over medium-high heat
Cook each dough round on griddle until dough bubbles and blisters appear, about 2 minutes
Flip and cook until lightly browned on the other side
